places.generalDescription: Located in Chandigarh, the ISKCON Temple is a vast Hare Krishna complex with a stunning marble temple, guest house, and library. The property offers easy access to popular attractions like Zakir Hussain Rose Garden, Government Museum and Art Gallery, Leisure Valley, The Rock Garden of Chandigarh, Elante mall, and Sukhna Lake. Additionally, the hotel provides quality accommodation with facilities such as travel desk, medical assistance, and banquet halls for social gatherings.

sources.snippet: Dedicated to Hindu Lord Krishna and Radha, ISKCON Temple in Chandigarh is much frequented by tourists and locals. If you are planning to explore the temple, try visiting in the evening hours, so that you can get the Prasadam. Timing: 4.30 am to 8.30 pm

places.generalDescription: Nek Chand‚Äôs Rock Garden of Chandigarh is a mesmerizing destination filled with mosaic courtyards, sculptures, and pathways made from old crockery. This lush garden is a testament to art and culture, offering visitors an immersive experience in its magical artworks. The garden features impressive artifacts spanning from the Middle Ages to contemporary art. Visitors can also explore themed gardens at Leisure Valley and enjoy a boat ride at Sukhna Lake during sundown.

sources.snippet: You can get a completely unique photo shoot done at the rock garden. The rock garden was created by Nek Chand out of the waste products which are generally thrown as waste. You can get a creative photoshoot done at the rock garden because the sculptor like creations are created from waste products.

sources.snippet: Nek Chand‚Äôs Rock Garden | #1 of 16 Best Places to Visit in Chandigarh. No trip to Chandigarh is ever complete without a visit to the renowned Rock Garden. Whether you are in the city with family and friends or on business, take some time out and make your way to this unique place.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Chandigarh: ‚úîLocation, Timings, Bus Stop

places.name: Nek Chand‚Äôs Rock Garden of Chandigarh

reviews.text:
Nek Chand's Rock Garden is a mesmerizing blend of art, creativity, and sustainability. This unique attraction showcases an incredible array of sculptures and installations made entirely from industrial and household waste materials, a testament to the vision and ingenuity of its creator.

The garden is divided into various sections, each offering something new and exciting to explore, from intricate statues to cascading waterfalls. It's not just a visual delight but also an inspiring experience, highlighting the beauty that can be created from discarded items.

The garden's pathways are easy to navigate, and the lush surroundings make it a refreshing retreat from the city's bustle. It's a perfect spot for families, art enthusiasts, and anyone looking for a unique experience.

While the place can get crowded during peak hours, its charm and the sense of wonder it evokes make it well worth a visit. A true gem of Chandigarh and a must-see for anyone in the region!

The Rock Garden Chandigarh is a 35 acre eco-friendly garden, built solely by home waste and other Industrial items.
Sculptures are created using items such as bangles, ceramic pots, tiles, bottles and Electric waste.
Garden is a mixture of Landscape, architecture, sculpture and mythology.
NEK CHAND, founder of Rock Garden, started creating this garden secretly during his spare time in 1957.
The Layout of Garden is based on the fantasy of a Lost Kingdom. It has 14 different chambers like the forecourt.
The Teej festival, when the Rock Garden assumes a festive look, holds a special attraction for tourists.

MAJOR ATTRACTIONS

PHASE 1:- Toilet fixtures, broken glass pieces and broken tiles have been used to create figures of humans and animals
PHASE 2:- Once you enter you will feel entering a small traditional Indian village representing beautifully carved huts, temples pathways etc.
PHASE 3:- It's inspired by Roman architecture; swings are hanging for people to enjoy the beauty.
Waterfall, Aquariums where we can get glimpse of fishes wandering around.
Open Air Theatre:- An open seating ground with stairs.
Laughing Mirror Display; Camel and Train ride.
Must visit to Dolls museum.
Souvenir Shop.
Food Court

Rock Garden in Chandigarh is truly one of the most unique places I have ever visited. It is not just a garden, but a living piece of art created with so much imagination and dedication. Nek Chand's vision of turning waste and discarded items into sculptures and creative structures is simply mind-blowing. Walking through the garden feels like stepping into a magical world ‚Äì every turn opens up to something new and unexpected. From human figures to animals, walls, waterfalls, and hidden passages, the entire place is full of creativity.

The garden is well-maintained, and the layout is designed in such a way that you can spend hours exploring without feeling bored. It is also a paradise for photographers ‚Äì every corner offers a perfect backdrop for pictures. Families, kids, and even solo travelers will enjoy the peaceful yet exciting vibe of the garden. The second phase with beautiful waterfalls and amphitheater-style seating adds to the charm, making it an ideal spot to relax after walking around.

What I loved most was how something as simple as broken tiles, bangles, and ceramic pieces has been transformed into timeless artwork. It sends out a strong message about recycling and sustainability, much before these concepts became popular.

The only thing to keep in mind is that the garden is quite big, so wear comfortable shoes and carry water. It can get crowded on weekends, so mornings are the best time to visit if you want a quieter experience.

Overall, Rock Garden is a must-visit landmark in Chandigarh ‚Äì a place that beautifully combines art, history, and creativity. It is not just a tourist attraction, but a cultural treasure of India. üåø‚ú®

places.address: Uttar Marg, Rock Garden of Chandigarh, Sector 1, Chandigarh, 160001, India

places.generalDescription: Sukhna Lake is a picturesque reservoir in Chandigarh, offering activities like pedal boating and jogging along its shores. It's a popular spot for photographers, with the shimmering lake framed by the majestic Shivalik hills providing stunning scenic views from sunrise to moonlit nights. The area also boasts attractions like the Cactus Garden, Rose Garden, and opportunities for trekking in the lower Shivalik Hills.

sources.snippet: Being in the heart of every person, This site can never fail to come in the list of best photography spots in Chandigarh Does this place even need any introduction?. They say beauty needs no introduction, but still, if you want to experience the amazing glaze of the shining lake which is framed by the majestic Shivalik hills, which gives the photographers the best scenic view to capture, From capturing the first sunlight falling on the glazing water to clicking the beauty of the moon at night, this place can never fail Photographers to snap a beautiful click in their cameras. Being one of the most photographed places in the world, if you are a Photography geek, you should surely mark this as the best photography place to visit in Chandigarh.

sources.snippet: Sukhna lake is one of the most famous man made lakes in India and a popular tourist place in Chandigarh. The place is most commonly known for sunrise and sunset only as the scene is so spectacular that you can't keep your eyes off and in such a peace that you can meditate and lighten your mood also.

Winters bring along the migratory birds to it and the lake blooms with the lotus cultivation in the monsoon season.

places.name: Terraced Garden

reviews.text:
In my view, it is one of the best gardens in chandigarh. Every year in the month of December a big flower festival  known as Chrysanthemum is organised by the UT administration which is very enjoyable. People come here to celebrate and enjoy music. There is a huge rush and also eating stalls are there.
On normal days I often visit this garden for morning walks. I really enjoyed this very much. There is now a huge rush of morning walks lovers. Outside Park a vegetable juice vendor named Mr. Suresh is there. People relish it after a walk.

Terraced gardens are beautifully designed landscapes that utilize a series of leveled platforms or "terraces," each separated by retaining walls, to manage hilly or sloped terrain. This design not only creates a visually stunning effect but also serves practical purposes, such as preventing soil erosion and managing water drainage. Each terrace can be cultivated with different plants, flowers, or even small trees, creating a layered effect that is both aesthetically pleasing and functional.In a terraced garden, the lower levels often feature ground-cover plants or flower beds, while the higher terraces might showcase shrubs, ornamental grasses, or even small waterfalls or fountains. This layering allows for a diverse range of plantings that can thrive in different conditions of sunlight and shade, depending on the orientation and height of each terrace. The pathways or steps connecting these levels can be made of stone, wood, or other materials, adding to the garden's charm and accessibility.The beauty of a terraced garden lies in its versatility and the opportunity it provides for creative landscaping. Whether it's a private residential garden or a larger public park, terraces can be designed to incorporate seating areas, viewing spots, or decorative elements like sculptures and pergolas. These gardens are often used to showcase a variety of plants and flowers, making them a popular choice for botanical displays or themed gardens.

The garden is lush and green, making it a perfect spot for walking or jogging. It's a beautiful place with stunning trees, and the Chrysanthemum show is the ideal time to visit. The garden is neat and very well maintained.

places.name: Zakir Hussain Rose Garden

reviews.text:
Zakir Hussain Rose Garden is one of the most beautiful and well-maintained gardens I've ever visited. Located in the heart of Chandigarh, it offers a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Spread across a vast area, the garden is home to over 1,600 species of roses, each one more stunning than the last. The sight of thousands of blooming roses in every possible shade is simply breathtaking and makes for a perfect spot for nature lovers and photographers alike.

What impressed me the most was the peaceful and clean environment. The garden is beautifully landscaped, with neat walking paths, green lawns, and soothing water fountains. Benches placed under shady trees offer visitors a place to relax and soak in the beauty around them. It's an ideal place for morning walks, family outings, or even a quiet afternoon alone with a book.

The Rose Festival held here annually is a major attraction, with cultural events, competitions, and a festive vibe that draws huge crowds. The garden is also very well-managed, with proper signs, security, and facilities, making the experience even more pleasant.

What sets this garden apart is not just the sheer variety of roses, but also the peaceful atmosphere it provides in the middle of a busy city. It's a place where you can truly connect with nature and feel rejuvenated.

Overall, Zakir Hussain Rose Garden is a must-visit destination if you're in Chandigarh. Whether you're a tourist or a local, this garden offers an unforgettable experience filled with colour, fragrance, and tranquility. Highly recommended for anyone looking to relax and enjoy the beauty of nature.

The Rose Garden is a breathtakingly beautiful place spread across a vast area, making it a paradise for nature lovers. The garden is exceptionally well-maintained, with lush greenery and a clean, serene atmosphere. It boasts thousands of varieties of roses, each more stunning than the last, creating a mesmerizing display of colors and fragrances.

Very peaceful. Love to visit this place in Feb or March when the roses blossoms. You can have a good time with ur family and kids. Lots of playing area available for kids. A good option while visiting Chandigarh.

places.generalDescription: Japanese Garden in Chandigarh, India, spans 13 acres and offers a captivating glimpse into Japanese culture. The park features meticulously designed gardens, pagodas, and sculptures that transport visitors to Japan. With serene ponds, picturesque bridges, and cherry blossoms reminiscent of the Far East, it's a haven for photographers seeking creative inspiration. This unique destination boasts a Zen experience unlike any other in the city.

sources.snippet: What if we told you, you can feel the essence of Japanese culture in India, Yes, correct, Japan has always been into creativity in the very first place, be it any form of art, sports, architecture, or technology, Japan never fails to amaze people by their creativity and so as Photographers, If you are a true photographer you must know what creativity means to you. Now keeping in mind the Japanese tradition, Chandigarh did its best to recreate the Japanese culture in its magnificent city, and is one of the most fascinating photography spots in Chandigarh.There are pretty ponds and nice bridges, and everything looks really neat and tidy. Photographers love it because it feels like stepping into Japan with all the cherry blossoms and the relaxing koi pond.

places.name: Japanese Garden, 31A Chandigarh

reviews.text: One of the best garden in Chandigarh. Awesome architect and scenic greenery. You can spend even 2-3 hours easily in this garden. There is no entry charges. Washrooms are also available inside the garden which are very well maintained. There are some small stalls outside the garden to have some snacks. There are two seperate gardens inside this place which are linked with a subway. Another part of this garden is based on Chinese dragon theme. People come here for picnic. A must visit place for morning or evening hangout. You may also bring badminton or soft ball for playing.

We enjoyed a pleasant walk through the park. While it was clean, it appeared somewhat under-maintained, with many features showing signs of wear. It's a peaceful retreat from the bustling streets of Chandigarh, though it falls short of capturing the authenticity and meticulous design of a traditional Japanese garden.

With the cordial coordination with Japan Government, this park was developed in 2011, shows some glimpses of Japanese Art and Culture.
Now in 2025, due to lack of maintenance this beautiful park is now so attractive.
But still it is a good place to spend time with family and friends.

places.name: Garden of Silence

reviews.text: It is a very beautiful place, when I went there I thought it would be silent or quiet as its name is ‚ÄòGarden of Silence' üòÖ but on the contrary there were a lot of people there, some people were just sitting and some were walking here and there, kids were playing cricket, football, badminton and also kabaddi. The ground is quite big, you can sit anywhere and enjoy the view. It is very close to Sukhna lake, you can walk around the lake and when I went there on Sunday there were a lot of people there.

Let me tell you, there is no silence in this garden. This garden is near sukhna lake. The children were playing cricket in the morning there. Good view of the garden though. There is a large statue of lord Buddha. Can visit it when visiting Sukhna lake.  Nice structured garden.

The Garden of Silence is a peaceful and beautifully designed spot, featuring a grand Buddha statue at its center. Though it's a small garden, it offers a refreshing environment, especially in the morning when children come to play and enjoy.

The variety of flowers in the garden adds to its beauty, making it a pleasant place to relax and unwind. However, I feel this space is not meant for cricket or any other sports. It should be restricted to walking, exploring, sitting, and simply soaking in the tranquil vibes. Ironically, despite its name, it's not always silent, but it still provides a calm atmosphere to escape the city's noise.

A great place to visit if you're looking for some relaxation and peaceful surroundings!

Visitors can explore diverse plant species from different regions while enjoying leisurely walks around a lake and through winding pathways.

reviews.text: ‚ÄúChandigarh Botanical Garden is a peaceful retreat for nature lovers. The lush greenery, diverse plant species, and well-maintained pathways make it a great spot for a relaxing stroll or a quiet escape. It's a perfect place for families, nature enthusiasts, or anyone looking to unwind amidst beautiful surroundings. A hidden gem in the city!‚Äù

Nice place to hangout, parking available, wheelchair accessible. Attaching photos. Bonsai World is a must. Free entry, just take 1 to 2 lt. of water along, as it's a big park so drinking water is compulsory to be taken along.

I can't believe I've lived here for so long and never visited this hidden gem! Went with my cousin and we had a wonderful time enjoying the serene landscape. The peaceful atmosphere made our long conversation even more special, and the beautiful sunset was truly the cherry on top.
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a calm escape from the usual city life.

Visitors flock to this picturesque spot not only for its floral beauty but also to enjoy the serene atmosphere created by flowering trees and a poignant war memorial dedicated to Indian soldiers.

Bougainvillea Park, a delightful green oasis, is a popular attraction known for its vibrant display of bougainvillea flowers and serene ambiance.
While there might be several parks with bougainvillea displays, one notable location is Bougainvillea Park in Chandigarh, India.

Situated in the well-planned city of Chandigarh, Bougainvillea Park is a testament to the city's commitment to incorporating green spaces into its urban fabric.
The park is characterized by lush green lawns, well-manicured gardens, and, of course, the striking presence of bougainvillea in various colors.

What makes Bougainvillea Park unique??
Ans... The emphasis on showcasing this beautiful flowering plant.
Bougainvillea, known for its vibrant bracts that come in hues of pink, purple, red, and orange, creates a visually stunning landscape.
The carefully curated arrangements and landscaping make the park a captivating destination for nature enthusiasts and photographers.

The park offers a peaceful retreat from the urban hustle, providing visitors with a chance to unwind amidst nature.
Benches and pathways are strategically placed, encouraging leisurely strolls and moments of relaxation.
Whether you're seeking solitude for introspection or a scenic spot for a picnic, Bougainvillea Park caters to a variety of preferences.

In addition to its scenic beauty, the park may host events, cultural activities, or even horticultural shows, further enhancing its appeal.
These events bring the community together and add a dynamic aspect to the tranquil surroundings.

Bougainvillea Park is not just a visual treat; it's a testament to the city's commitment to green urban planning.
The careful curation of plant life, combined with thoughtful landscaping, creates an environment that celebrates nature's beauty.
Whether you're a resident or a visitor, Bougainvillea Park offers a refreshing escape and a chance to appreciate the enchanting allure of bougainvillea in full bloomüíö

The Chandigarh Bird Park, located in the heart of Chandigarh near Sukhna Lake, is a serene haven for bird enthusiasts and nature lovers. places.name: Chandigarh Bird Park

reviews.text:
Chandigarh Bird Park: We absolutely love this place! It's perfect for kids and family picnics. Surprisingly, it wasn't too crowded on a Sunday morning, which made the visit even better. The park features shaded picnic tables, a fantastic playground, and well-maintained bird enclosures. The Chandigarh Forest Department has done an incredible job creating this space right in the heart of the city (Near Sukhna Lake and governor house).

Kids were thrilled to experience birds up close, making it an unforgettable visit. Stepping into the large bird enclosures felt like a scene from Jurassic Park, with wooden bridges, waterfalls, and charming huts adding to the adventure. We purchased the Winged Wonder ticket for just ‚Çπ100, and it was absolutely worth it-highly recommend buying it at the entrance.

Wheelchair ‚ôø-accessible limited street parking üÖøÔ∏è is available, but weekends can get crowded, so using public transport is a good idea. A must-visit spot for families, especially those with young kids! Sharing my pictures üñºÔ∏è

A Hidden Paradise for Bird Lovers!
Visiting Chandigarh Bird Park was such a joyful experience! The moment I stepped in, I felt connected to nature in the most peaceful way. The beautifully maintained enclosures and free-flying exotic birds made me feel like I was in a mini jungle paradise. I was amazed to see so many colorful species up close ‚Äì it's both fun and educational. The staff is friendly, and the place is super clean. Perfect spot for families, kids, or anyone who just wants to spend some peaceful time with nature. I left with a big smile and a happy heart!

Dear Viewers üòÉ
Bird park located in sec 1 nearby rock garden so add this place if you are nature and birds lover.
A peaceful hidden gem in the heart of Chandigarh üê¶ ü¶ú ‚ú® The Birds Park is a delightful place to experience the beauty of nature up close. The park is home to a variety of colorful and exotic patriots and birds, and the surroundings are clean, green, and well-maintained. It's a perfect spot for families, nature lovers, and photography enthusiasts.
Specially kids love this place. A refreshing escape from the city hustle - highly recommended for a relaxing visit!

sources.snippet: 5 km from city center 34 out of 54 Places To Visit in Chandigarh. One of the popular places which you need to visit whenever you arrive in Chandigarh is Kalagram. It is a popular craft village which is one of the major tourist attractions.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Chandigarh | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Kalagram

reviews.text: Visited  National Craft Mela, 2024 & impressed with the arrangements along with available shopping stalls. I personally love cuisines from different states.

A Cultural Gem ‚Äì Kalagram

Kalagram is a true cultural gem that beautifully captures the essence of art, heritage, and creativity! Nestled in a peaceful corner, this vibrant space serves as a hub for artists, craftsmen, and cultural enthusiasts. Whether you're an art lover, a tourist exploring the local culture, or a family looking for a unique outing, Kalagram has something special to offer.

Artistic Ambiance & Traditional Vibe

The first thing that strikes you upon entering Kalagram is its charming and rustic ambiance. The open spaces adorned with traditional murals, handcrafted sculptures, and intricate artwork reflect the richness of Indian culture. The combination of earthy tones, folk motifs, and vibrant colors creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere. It's a place that instantly connects you to the roots of traditional craftsmanship.

Exquisite Handicrafts & Artworks

Kalagram is a paradise for anyone interested in handicrafts and indigenous arts. The variety of handcrafted items available here is impressive - from intricate pottery and terracotta sculptures to beautiful textiles, jewelry, and wooden artifacts. Each piece tells a unique story of the artisan's skill and creativity. The opportunity to watch artisans at work, crafting their masterpieces with passion and precision, is an experience in itself.

Cultural Events & Workshops

One of the most engaging aspects of Kalagram is its regular cultural events and workshops. From folk dance performances and musical evenings to pottery-making and painting workshops, there is always something happening that draws you into the cultural tapestry of the region. These events not only provide entertainment but also serve as educational experiences for visitors, helping them understand the history and traditions behind each art form.

Perfect for Shopping & Souvenirs

If you're looking for authentic souvenirs or meaningful gifts, Kalagram is the perfect place. The products are not just beautiful; they reflect the heritage and skill of local artisans. Unlike mass-produced items, each piece here has a personal touch, making it special and valuable. Prices are reasonable considering the craftsmanship, and purchasing here supports local artists and their livelihoods.

Food & Refreshment Options

Kalagram also offers delightful food options that complement the cultural experience. Small eateries serve traditional snacks, local cuisine, and refreshing beverages that add to the overall experience. Enjoying a cup of hot chai while exploring the artistic surroundings is simply delightful!

Visitor-Friendly & Well-Maintained

The place is well-maintained, clean, and organized. The staff members and artisans are friendly, approachable, and always willing to share insights about their work. Parking is easily available, and the entire space is designed to be accessible for all age groups. The sense of safety and community adds to the comfort of visiting this creative haven.

Why Visit Kalagram?

Whether you are a tourist exploring the local culture, a student of arts looking for inspiration, or a family seeking a meaningful outing, Kalagram is a must-visit. It's a place where tradition meets creativity, where every corner inspires curiosity, and every artwork tells a story.

Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates art, culture, and creativity! Don't miss the chance to experience the heart of traditional craftsmanship at Kalagram.
Nice get together place. Very convenient to reach.

places.generalDescription: The Open Hand Monument, situated in the Capitol Complex of Chandigarh, is a significant architectural creation by the renowned architect Le Corbusier. This iconic 85-foot structure features a large hand with an open palm, symbolizing peace, unity, and acceptance of new ideas. Designed to represent the positive aspects of the city, it stands as a prominent landmark and embodies the theme of peace and reconciliation. The monument's symbolic significance extends beyond Chandigarh to captivate visitors from around the world.

sources.snippet: The hand which stands tall over the whole place, A symbol of peace and unity, the Open Hand Monument is a graceful art of the human mind and what all photographer wants, an art or picture that has a story to tell and that is what this monument provides. When the sun goes down, it makes cool shadows on the grass, and photographers love taking pictures of it because it looks really cool with all the light and shadows.

places.name: The Open Hand Monument

reviews.text:
The Open Hand Monument in Chandigarh is one of the most iconic structures designed by Le Corbusier, the architect of the city. Located in Capitol Complex, this 26-meter-high metal structure symbolizes peace, unity, and the exchange of ideas. The hand is designed to rotate with the wind, representing openness to change and progress.

The monument is not just an architectural marvel but also holds deep philosophical meaning, reflecting Chandigarh's spirit as a modern and progressive city. If you're interested in architecture, history, or just want to see something unique, it's definitely worth a visit. Plus, the entire Capitol Complex is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, adding to its significance.

This is a wonderful construction french architect , This was a symbol of peace , friendship and safe...in another way it seems like a flying bird..It was a weight of 50tons and even on this weight it rotates 360¬∞very easily.For easy rotation it need equal weight and balance, that is the talent of the architect. This site in Chandigarh is UNESCO certified site...they are other 5 monuments in the same site with unic architecture...
It's in a high security area as its high court assembly is there. We have to take permission from authorities.

places.generalDescription: The Government Museum and Art Gallery in Chandigarh is a must-visit museum complex that showcases a diverse range of exhibits, including ancient and modern art, architecture, natural history, Gandharan sculptures, terracotta heads from ancient India, medieval metal sculptures, miniature paintings, manuscripts, textiles from across the Indian subcontinent and more. The museum also houses a collection of artwork by renowned artists.

sources.snippet: Government Museum and Art Gallery | #5 of 16 Best Places to Visit in Chandigarh. Overshadowed by the allure of other more famed points of interest on this list, the Government Museum and Art Gallery might just be the most underrated Museum in Chandigarh. The place owes its creation to the partition of India and Pakistan that took place in 1947.
sources.shortName: Places to Visit in Chandigarh: ‚úîLocation, Timings, Bus Stop

sources.snippet: The massive art Gallery is located in sector 10 and is one of the most interesting places in Chandigarh. The museum contains antiquities from the Indus valley civilization to different paintings and coins from the ancient and historical times. The gallery also contains the dinosaur fossils which were excavated in the region.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Places To Visit In Chandigarh

sources.snippet: Established in 1968, Government Museum and Art Gallery houses collection of miniature paintings, artifacts, and stone sculptures. A few of the artifacts were earlier showcased in the Central Museum of Lahore. However, after independence and construction of this museum, all of those were brought in here.
sources.shortName: Road Trips to Picnic Places and Amusement Parks in Chandigarh

places.name: Government Museum and Art Gallery

reviews.text: Sharing with you some of the pictures I enjoyed the art gallery is a highlight of this entire establishment. Who knew you could buy an experience so vivid for 30 rs. Tickets could be bought online or from counter if you wish the museum has a shop for sale of replicas which I consider are of good quality. Please be informed the closing time is 4:30 and you need 1.5 hrs min for exploring the entire area

This museum has two parts viz. Art museum and Natural history museum out of which only Natural history museum is great. This museum was formerly known as Museum of human evolution. It is such an amazing museum where you will know how the earth was born and evolved till today, how human evolved and how dinasaurs evolved and destroyed. The sculptures are damn amazing and realistic. A must visit place.

I have finally discovered a treasure trove in Chandigarh.
This Government Museum of art and architecture is like a hidden gem which I guess many are unaware of.
A friend mentioned about this institution in Sector 10 in the passing and I decided to check this out on a weekday.
The building, the presentation, the collection -- it blew away my mind.

Basically there are three important buildings -- one is dedicated to Architecture, the other to Natural History and the last one is dedicated to art, paintings and sculptures.

Everything is very well placed in spacious halls, very well marked and labelled. At most of the installations and paintings the descriptions are both in English and in Braille. It's so heartening to see the thoughtfulness in even the layout as ramps help in the movements of wheel chair bound art connoisseurs

The charges are minimal and you can even ask for a guide. A few hours spent here is just like touching the tip of the iceberg. I guess many more trips to the various sections of the museum should be planned in order to know and appreciate our art, culture and heritage.

It was so nice to see a batch of young school children being taken around -- an early awareness will help them mould well.
A word for the staff -- very polite and helpful. They are certainly an asset to the museum.
Looking forward to many more trips of discovery to this wonderful place

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Sector 35 of Chandigarh, Topiary Park is a delightful oasis that captivates visitors with its stunning array of topiary sculptures and beautifully landscaped gardens. Spanning a generous area, this park features an impressive collection of meticulously shaped plants that resemble various animals, creating a whimsical atmosphere perfect for family outings. Established in 1987, it has become a beloved destination for children and adults alike.

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 47 out of 54 Places To Visit in Chandigarh. Topiary Park, located in Chandigarh, is a unique green space renowned for its meticulously sculpted bushes and trees that resemble various shapes, animals, and objects. This park offers visitors a delightful experience amidst creatively trimmed foliage, providing a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of urban life.
sources.shortName: 52 Best Places to visit in Chandigarh | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Topiary Park is an amazing place to be as you can find varieties of topiaries in the shape of animals here. You will also be able to see varieties of ornamental plants in this garden.

places.name: Topiary Park, 35A Chandigarh

reviews.text: Really nice park in sector 35. It is near Gurudwara Sahib and is a big park. Good for having picnic here.

In the heart of the city, Topiary Park stands out with its neatness and unique morning charm. It's a great spot for anyone looking to relax. The carefully shaped trees add a fun touch to the peaceful setting. The park is clean, making it even more calming. The pond attracts birds, filling the air with their songs. It's a lovely memory to take home. Amidst our noisy routines, a visit here feels like a refreshing break. It helps us see time differently and appreciate nature's beauty. Topiary Park is a simple yet wonderful escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life.

Wonderful park for children's and also for elders.
Or excercise and yoga .

Very neat and clean park.
Chairs are also available.
Very peaceful in afternoon time üåÑüòäüòä

places.generalDescription: City Bird Sanctuary, also known as the Chandigarh Bird Park, is a hidden gem for bird lovers and couples. It features vibrant parrots and various avian species, making it a must-visit spot in Chandigarh. Meanwhile, Chail Bird Sanctuary in Himachal Pradesh covers 110 square kilometers and offers an exciting adventure for nature enthusiasts. The sanctuary boasts two large aviaries with ample space for terrestrial and aquatic birds to fly and nest naturally while visitors stroll by.

sources.snippet: 46 km from city center 51 out of 54 Places To Visit in Chandigarh. The City Bird Wildlife Sanctuary is located in sector 21 of Chandigarh. It is also popularly known as Parrot Bird Sanctuary due to the presence of hundreds of different types of parrots.

places.name: City Bird Sanctuary 21 Chd

reviews.text:
The City Bird Park in Sector 21, Chandigarh,  is a popular attraction for bird lovers and families.
Timings:
- Morning:* 9:00 AM ‚Äì 12:00 PM
- Evening: 3:00 PM ‚Äì 6:00 PM (may vary seasonally)
ü¶ú Aviary & Bird Enclosures ‚Äì Houses a variety of exotic and local birds.
Natural Setting ‚Äì Lush greenery, walking paths, and shaded seating.
‚Äì Great for bird-watching and family pictures.

Best Time to Visit:
- Early morning or late afternoon (to avoid heat and see active birds).

The sanctuary has been well built and well maintained. It gives you a feeling of strolling in the nature. Variety of plants, flowers, trees all around... There are variety of birds like black swan, love bird (parrot with multiple colors). Unfortunately we could not spot many birds may because of hibernation. But the place is really nice it gives you a peaceful feeling in the mid of city chaos.

First of all this is not the actual bird park that most of the visitors hope to visit. This is actually a regular park. The pictures and videos posted for this location are actually from the actual bird park that you wish to visit. Irrespective of all this, this park is well maintained and full of greenery. It won't be a waste of time if you spend your time in the midst of greenery here.

places.generalDescription: Hibiscus Garden, located in Sector 36 of Chandigarh, is a renowned botanical oasis that spans across 8 acres. Established in 1974, it played a pivotal role in earning Chandigarh its reputation as the 'City of Gardens'. The garden is home to an impressive collection of over 40 varieties of hibiscus shrubs, ensuring a vibrant and colorful display throughout the year.

sources.snippet: 2 km from city center 35 out of 54 Places To Visit in Chandigarh. Established in 1996, Hibiscus Garden is a botanical oasis spanning across an expansive 8-acre area in Sector 36 of Chandigarh. This picturesque garden boasts an impressive collection of over 40 varieties of hibiscus shrubs, showcasing the diversity and beauty of these vibrant flowers.

places.generalDescription: Butterfly Park in Chandigarh is a beautifully landscaped park and conservatory that boasts an array of trees, shrubs, and flowers, serving as a magnet for 35 different species of butterflies. Managed by the Forest and Wildlife Department of Chandigarh, this iconic location spans over 7 acres and offers visitors the opportunity to discover numerous butterfly species. It's an inexpensive yet unique attraction suitable for all age groups.

sources.snippet: With manicured bushes, Butterfly Park boasts of housing more than 35 species of butterflies. For a smooth breeding of the butterflies, a perfect environment is facilitated at this park. An amazing feature of this park is that there is a silence zone here where visitors are not allowed to make loud noise.

sources.snippet: Tucked away in Sector 26, Chandigarh, Butterfly Park is a tranquil oasis amidst the bustling city life. places.name: Butterfly Park, 26 Chandigarh

reviews.text: Very peaceful and serene atmosphere. Best time to visit is during spring and onset of summers. Must visit for children to learn about flora and fauna. Very less crowd, perfect getaway from city life in the midst of a city itself.

A little known out of the way attraction. Many go to Suknah Lake or the Rock Garden.  I didn't see a lot of butterflies that day but it was a peaceful stroll. A nice little getaway ‚ù§Ô∏è This was a few years ago while I was visiting.

Visited the Butterfly Garden in Chandigarh recently just to kill some time. It's an okayish place overall. There are a few wild mulberry and mango trees scattered around, and I even spotted a lone pear tree. I went in spring, which seemed like the off-season - I believe it would look a lot better in winters when it's greener and more lively.
That said, if you're in the city looking for a peaceful spot to unwind, it's not a bad choice. But if you're after a more vibrant experience, I'd still recommend heading to Sukhna Lake instead.

places.address: Nitttr, Sector 26, Chandigarh, 160019, India
